items.name: ResourceManager
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: ResourceManager # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class ResourceManagerContext ###* * If associated to a gs.ResourceManager, a resource context registers all loaded resources * resources. If gs.ResourceManager needs to dispose resources, it will only dispose * resource associated if the current context. * * By default, each game scene creates it's own resource context to only dispose resources * created by itself. * * @module gs * @class ResourceManager * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * All resources associated with this context. * @property resources * @type Object[] * @readOnly ### @resources = [] ###* * Converts the resource context into a data-bundle for serialization. The data-bundle will only contain * the names of the resources associated with this context but not the resource-data itself. * @method toDataBundle * @return {string[]} An array of resource names associated with this context. ### toDataBundle: -> @resources.select (r) -> r.name ###* * Initializes the resource context from a data-bundle. Any already existing resource associations * with this context will be deleted. * @method fromDataBundle ### fromDataBundle: (data, resourcesByPath) -> @resources = data.select (n) -> name: n, data: resourcesByPath[n] ###* * Adds the specified resource to the context. * @method add * @param {string} name - A unique name for the resource like the file-path for example. * @param {gs.Bitmap|gs.AudioBuffer|gs.Video|gs.Live2DModel} data - The resource data like a gs.Bitmap object for example. ### add: (name, resource) -> @resources.push({ name: name, data: resource }) ###* * Removes the resource with the specified name from the context. * @method remove * @param {string} name - The name of the resource to remove. For Example: The file name. ### remove: (name) -> @resources.remove(@resources.first((r) -> r.name == name)) gs.ResourceManagerContext = ResourceManagerContext class ResourceManager ###* * Manages the resources of the game like graphics, audio, fonts, etc. It * offers a lot of methods to easily access game resources and automatically * caches them. So if an image is requested a second time it will be taken * from the cache instead of loading it again. * * @module gs * @class ResourceManager * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * Current resource context. All loaded resources will be associated with it. If current context * is set to null, the systemContext is used instead. * @property context * @type gs.ResourceManagerContext * @protected ### @context_ = null ###* * System resource context. All loaded system resources are associated with this context. Resources * which are associated with the system context are not disposed until the game ends. * @property context * @type gs.ResourceManagerContext ### @systemContext = @createContext() ###* * Holds in-memory created bitmaps. * @property customBitmapsByKey * @type Object * @protected ### @customBitmapsByKey = {} ###* * Caches resources by file path. * @property resourcesByPath * @type Object * @protected ### @resourcesByPath = {} ###* * Caches resources by file path and HUE. * @property resourcesByPath * @type Object * @protected ### @resourcesByPathHue = {} ###* * Stores all loaded resources. * @property resources * @type Object[] ### @resources = [] ###* * Indicates if all requested resources are loaded. * @property resourcesLoaded * @type boolean ### @resourcesLoaded = true ###* * @property events * @type gs.EventEmitter ### @events = new gs.EventEmitter() ###* * Current resource context. All loaded resources will be associated with it. If current context * is set to null, the systemContext is used instead. * @property context * @type gs.ResourceManagerContext ### @accessors "context", set: (v) -> @context_ = v get: -> @context_ ? @systemContext ###* * Creates a new resource context. Use context to set the new created context * as current context. * * @method createContext ### createContext: -> new gs.ResourceManagerContext() ###* * Disposes all bitmap resources associated with the current context. * * @method disposeBitmaps ### disposeBitmaps: -> for resource in @context.resources if resource.data instanceof gs.Bitmap resource.data.dispose() @resources.remove(@resources.first ((r) -> result = r.filePath == resource.data.filePath r.dispose() if result return result )) @resources.remove(resource.data) if resource.name @resourcesByPath[resource.name] = null delete @resourcesByPath[resource.name] ###* * Disposes all video resources associated with the current context. * * @method disposeVideos ### disposeVideos: -> for resource in @context.resources if resource.data instanceof gs.Video resource.data.dispose() @resources.remove(resource.data) @resourcesByPath[resource.name] = null delete @resourcesByPath[resource.name] ###* * Disposes all audio resources associated with the current context. * * @method disposeAudio ### disposeAudio: -> AudioManager.dispose(@context) for resource in @context.resources if resource.data instanceof GS.AudioBuffer or resource instanceof GS.AudioBufferStream resource.data.dispose() @resources.remove(resource.data) @resourcesByPath[resource.name] = null delete @resourcesByPath[resource.name] ###* * Disposes all Live2D resources associated with the current context. * * @method disposeLive2D ### disposeLive2D: -> for resource in @context.resources if (resource.data instanceof gs.Live2DModel_21) || (resource.data instanceof gs.Live2DModel_40) resource.data.dispose() @resources.remove(resource.data) @resourcesByPath[resource.name] = null delete @resourcesByPath[resource.name] ###* * Disposes all resources. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> @disposeBitmaps() @disposeVideos() @disposeAudio() @disposeLive2D() @context = @systemContext ###* * Loads all custom fonts in Graphics/Fonts folder. * * @method loadFonts ### loadFonts: -> resource = { loaded: no } @resources.push(resource) @resourcesByPath["Graphics/Fonts"] = resource gs.Font.loadCustomFonts((error) => @resourcesByPath["Graphics/Fonts"].loaded = yes if error @resourcesByPath["Graphics/Fonts"].error = yes ) ###* * Gets a custom created bitmap by key. * * @method getCustomBitmap * @param {String} key - The key for the bitmap to get. * @return {gs.Bitmap} The bitmap or null if no bitmap exists for the specified key. ### getCustomBitmap: (key) -> return @customBitmapsByKey[key] ###* * Sets a custom created bitmap for a specified key. * * @method setCustomBitmap * @param {String} key - The key for the bitmap to set. * @param {gs.Bitmap} bitmap - The bitmap to set. ### setCustomBitmap: (key, bitmap) -> @customBitmapsByKey[key] = bitmap if not bitmap.loaded? @resources.push(bitmap) @resourcesLoaded = false ###* * Adds a custom created bitmap to the resource manager. * * @method addCustomBitmap * @param {gs.Bitmap} bitmap - The bitmap to add. ### addCustomBitmap: (bitmap) -> @context.resources.push(name: "", data: bitmap) ###* * Gets a Live2D model. * * @method getLive2DModel * @param {String} filePath - Path to the Live2D model file. * @return {gs.Live2DModel} The Live2D model or null if no model exists at the specified file path. ### getLive2DModel: (filePath) -> result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] if not result? or result.disposed profile = LanguageManager.profile result = gs.Live2DModel.create(filePath, (if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null)) @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false @context.resources.push(name: filePath, data: result) return result ###* * Gets a font. * * @method getFont * @param {String} name - The name of the font to get. * @param {number} size - The size of the font to get. * @return {gs.Font} The font or null if no font with the specified name exists. ### getFont: (name, size) -> result = new Font(name, size) @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false return result ###* * Gets a video. * * @method getVideo * @param {String} filePath - Path to the video file. * @return {gs.Video} The video or null if no video exists at the specified file path. ### getVideo: (filePath) -> if filePath.endsWith("/") then return null result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] if not result? or result.disposed profile = LanguageManager.profile result = new gs.Video(filePath, (if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null)) @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false @context.resources.push(name: filePath, data: result) return result ###* * Gets the correct file path for the specified resource. * * @method getPath * @param {Object} resource - The resource object which is usually stored inside a command's params or in data records. * @return {String} The correct file path for the specified resource. ### getPath: (resource) -> if resource? then "#{resource.folderPath}/#{resource.name}" else "" ###* * Gets a bitmap. * * @method getBitmap * @param {String|Object} filePath - Path to the bitmap file OR a graphic info object. * @param {number} hue - The bitmap's hue. The bitmap will be loaded and then recolored. * @return {gs.Bitmap} The bitmap or null if no bitmap exists at the specified file path. ### getBitmap: (filePath, hue) -> if filePath.endsWith("/") then return null hue = hue || 0 result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] || @customBitmapsByKey[filePath] if not result? profile = LanguageManager.profile result = new Bitmap(filePath, (if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null), no) result.hue = hue result.filePath = filePath @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false @context.resources.push(name: filePath, data: result) else if not result.loaded and result.hue != hue profile = LanguageManager.profile result = new Bitmap(filePath, (if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null)) result.hue = hue result.filePath = filePath @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false else if hue > 0 hueBitmap = @resourcesByPathHue[filePath+"@"+hue] if not hueBitmap? and result.loaded hueBitmap = new Bitmap(result.image) hueBitmap.changeHue(hue) @resourcesByPathHue[filePath+"@"+hue] = hueBitmap if hueBitmap? then result = hueBitmap return result ###* * Gets an HTML image. * * @method getImage * @param {String} filePath - Path to the image file. * @return {HTMLImageElement} The image or null if no image exists at the specified file path. ### getImage: (filePath) -> result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] if not result? result = new Bitmap("resources/#{filePath}.png"); @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false return result ###* * Gets an audio stream. * * @method getAudioStream * @param {String} filePath - Path to the audio file. * @return {gs.AudioBuffer} The audio buffer or null if no audio file exists at the specified file path. ### getAudioStream: (filePath) -> result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] profile = LanguageManager.profile languageCode = if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null if not result? result = new GS.AudioBuffer(filePath) @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false @context.resources.push(name: filePath, data: result) return result ###* * Gets an audio buffer. The audio data is fully loaded and decoded in memory. It is recommeneded * for sound effects but for a long background music, getAudioStream should be used instead. That is especially * the case on mobile devices. * * @method getAudioBuffer * @param {String} filePath - Path to the audio file. * @return {gs.AudioBuffer} The audio buffer or null if no audio file exists at the specified file path. ### getAudioBuffer: (filePath) -> result = @resourcesByPath[filePath] profile = LanguageManager.profile languageCode = if profile? and profile.items? then profile.items.code else null if not result? result = new GS.AudioBuffer(filePath) @resourcesByPath[filePath] = result @resources.push(result) @resourcesLoaded = false @context.resources.push(name: filePath, data: result) return result ###* * Updates the loading process. Needs to be called once per frame to keep * the ResourceManager up to date. * * @method update ### update: -> if not @events? then @events = new gs.EventEmitter() if not @resourcesLoaded @resourcesLoaded = true for i in [0...@resources.length] if not @resources[i].loaded @resourcesLoaded = false break else if @resources[i].hue? and @resources[i].hue > 0 bitmap = new Bitmap(@resources[i].image) @resourcesByPath[@resources[i].filePath] = bitmap @resources[i].changeHue(@resources[i].hue) @resourcesByPathHue[@resources[i].filePath+"@"+@resources[i].hue] = @resources[i] delete @resources[i].filePath delete @resources[i].hue if @resourcesLoaded @events.emit("loaded", this) return null window.ResourceManager = ResourceManager gs.ResourceManager = ResourceManager
